trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.SELECTOR]
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore - portal
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore - portal

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore - REST API
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore - REST API

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in [Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in [Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Restrictions and Security
trans-unit.target: Restrictions and Security

trans-unit.source: See [Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal](sql-database-geo-restore-tutorial-management-portal.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal](sql-database-geo-restore-tutorial-management-portal.md).

trans-unit.source: How to: Recover an Azure SQL database with Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: How to: Recover an Azure SQL database with Geo-Restore in Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.
trans-unit.target: You must use certificate based authentication to run the following cmdlets.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the *Use the certificate method* section in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md#use-the-certificate-method).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the *Use the certificate method* section in [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md#use-the-certificate-method).

trans-unit.source: Get the list of recoverable databases by using the [Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720219.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Get the list of recoverable databases by using the [Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720219.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameter:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameter:

trans-unit.source: **ServerName** where the database is located.
trans-unit.target: **ServerName** where the database is located.

trans-unit.source: Choose the database you want to recover from by using the [Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720219.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Choose the database you want to recover from by using the [Get-AzureSqlRecoverableDatabase](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn720219.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: **ServerName** where the database is located.
trans-unit.target: **ServerName** where the database is located.

trans-unit.source: **DatabaseName** of the database you are recovering from.
trans-unit.target: **DatabaseName** of the database you are recovering from.

trans-unit.source: Begin the recover by using the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720224.aspx) cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Begin the recover by using the [Start-AzureSqlDatabaseRecovery](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn720224.aspx) cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: **SourceDatabase** you want to recover.
trans-unit.target: **SourceDatabase** you want to recover.

trans-unit.source: **TargetDatabaseName** of the database you are recovering to.
trans-unit.target: **TargetDatabaseName** of the database you are recovering to.

trans-unit.source: **TargetServerName** you want to recover the database to.
trans-unit.target: **TargetServerName** you want to recover the database to.

trans-unit.source: Store what is returned to a variable called **$RestoreRequest**.
trans-unit.target: Store what is returned to a variable called **$RestoreRequest**.

trans-unit.source: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.
trans-unit.target: This variable contains the restore request ID which is used for monitoring the status of a restore.

trans-unit.source: A database recovery may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A database recovery may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the recovery, use the [Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn546738.aspx) cmdlet and specify the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the recovery, use the [Get-AzureSqlDatabaseOperation](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn546738.aspx) cmdlet and specify the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: **ServerName** of the database you are restoring to.
trans-unit.target: **ServerName** of the database you are restoring to.

trans-unit.source: **OperationGuid** which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the **$RecoveryRequest** variable in Step 3.
trans-unit.target: **OperationGuid** which is the Restore Request ID that was stored in the **$RecoveryRequest** variable in Step 3.

trans-unit.source: The **State** and **PercentComplete** fields show the status of the restore.
trans-unit.target: The **State** and **PercentComplete** fields show the status of the restore.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
